name: Butter Naan
history: Butter Naan is a variant of the classic Naan, a traditional Indian flatbread. It is particularly popular in North India and is known for its rich buttery flavor, which enhances the overall taste and texture of the bread.
description: Butter Naan is a soft, leavened flatbread made from refined flour and enriched with butter. It's typically cooked in a tandoor or on a skillet, resulting in a deliciously aromatic bread with a slightly crispy exterior and soft interior.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let it sit for 10 minutes until frothy. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and yogurt. Add the yeast mixture and knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 2-3 hours.

instructions.title: Roll the Naans
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into an oval shape.

instructions.title: Cook the Naans
instructions.description: Heat a tawa or skillet. Place the rolled naan on it and cook until bubbles appear. Flip and cook the other side until brown spots appear. Brush with melted butter.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with curries, dal, or as a standalone snack.

tips: Ensure the water is warm, not hot, to activate the yeast properly.
The dough should be soft and pliable for the best texture.
variations: Add garlic or herbs to the dough for additional flavors.
Stuff with cheese or spiced potatoes for a filling variant.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a skillet before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot skillet or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve in a basket lined with a cloth to keep the naan warm.
Pair with a variety of dips and side dishes for a complete meal.
